CardTest.card_test_question_1: Hvordan får man penger på kortet?
CardTest.card_test_question_2: Kan man kjøpe et par høretelefoner for %1$d om saldoen din er %2$d?
CardTest.card_test_question_3: Hva bør du gjøre med PIN koden til kortet?
CardTest.card_test_question_4: Hva skjer om man taster inn PIN kode feil 3 ganger?
CardTest.card_test_question_5: Hva bør du gjøre om du oppdager en transaksjon som du ikke husker å ha utført?
CardTest.card_test_question_6: Hva er det viktigste å tenke på når man handler på nettet?
CardTest.card_test_question_7: Hva skjer om du skaffer et abbonement som koster %1$d per måned
CardTest.card_test_question_8: Bør du låne ut kortet til noen andre?
CardTest.card_test_question_9: Hva bør du gjøre om du mister kortet?
CardTest.card_test_question_10: Hva bør du gjøre om noen spør deg om kort nummeret og CVV kode?
CardTest.card_test_question_1_answer_1: Noen som er koblet til kortet vil sette inn penger på din konto
CardTest.card_test_question_1_answer_2: Kortet er koblet til sentralbanken, og alle kan bruke pengene der
CardTest.card_test_question_1_answer_3: Jeg la kortet i lommeboken sammen med pengene
CardTest.card_test_question_2_answer_1: Ja, hvordan kan butikken vite hvor mye penger jeg har på kortet?
CardTest.card_test_question_2_answer_2: Ja, men da vil jeg skylde banken 10 kr
CardTest.card_test_question_2_answer_3: Nei, jeg kan ikke kjøpe høretelefonene fordi det er ikke nok penger på kortet mitt
CardTest.card_test_question_3_answer_1: Skriv det på baksiden av kortet mitt
CardTest.card_test_question_3_answer_2: Skriv det på en papirbit og legg det i lommeboken din
CardTest.card_test_question_3_answer_3: Lær deg det utenatt og ikke del det med noen
CardTest.card_test_question_4_answer_2: Jeg må betale dobbelt så mye
CardTest.card_test_question_5_answer_1: Blokker kortet til jeg har undersøkt grunnen nærmere.
CardTest.card_test_question_5_answer_3: Sett inn mer penger på kortet
CardTest.card_test_question_6_answer_1: Sånn at jeg får de beste avtalene
CardTest.card_test_question_6_answer_2: At jeg kjøper fra en sikker internettside
CardTest.card_test_question_7_answer_1: Jeg vil få 99 kr hver måned
CardTest.card_test_question_7_answer_2: 99 kr vil automatisk bli trukket fra din konto hver måned
CardTest.card_test_question_7_answer_3: Jeg må betale 99 kr i rente hver måned
CardTest.card_test_question_8_answer_1: Ja, men bare til de som virkelig behøver hjelp
CardTest.card_test_question_8_answer_2: Ja, men bare til noen på samme alder som meg
CardTest.card_test_question_8_answer_3: Nei, du bør ikke låne ut kortet til noen andre
CardTest.card_test_question_9_answer_3: Ingenting, om jeg ikke har brukt kortet på en uke, vil et nytt bli sendt til meg
CardTest.card_test_question_10_answer_1: Jeg vil gi dem mitt kortnummer og CVV kode
CardTest.card_test_question_10_answer_2: Jeg vil bare gi dem min CVV kode fordi kortnummeret er hemmelig
CardTest.card_test_question_10_answer_3: Jeg kommer ikke til å gi dem noen av dem, begge er hemmelige

FinancialLiteracyTest1.question_1: Anna likes math, but not writing or working with her hands. Which job suits her the best?
FinancialLiteracyTest1.question_2: Lina is a dogwalker. Ella has an internship at a school. Nora is a hairdresser. Lars is studying medicine. Who has an income?
FinancialLiteracyTest1.question_3: Jimmy lends a friend $c{1000}. A year later he gets $c{1100} back. What are the extra $c{100} called?
FinancialLiteracyTest1.question_4: Leo wants a $c{1000} loan. Which one should he choose to pay as little interest as possible?
FinancialLiteracyTest1.question_5: Kim has earned $c{4000} by selling 1000 cookies. If the cost was $c{3000}, what was the profit?
FinancialLiteracyTest1.question_6: Daniel sells mobile phones. He get $c{300} per each sold phone. What are the $c{300} called?
FinancialLiteracyTest1.question_7: Johan has started a company. What will his company make if it's successful?
FinancialLiteracyTest1.question_4_answer_1: A short-term loan with a high interest rate
FinancialLiteracyTest1.question_4_answer_2: A short-term loan with a low interest rate
FinancialLiteracyTest1.question_4_answer_3: A long-term loan with a high interest rate
FinancialLiteracyTest1.question_4_answer_4: A long-term loan with a low interest rate

FinancialLiteracyTest2.question_1: Many people invest their money. What do they expect an increase in?
FinancialLiteracyTest2.question_3: Interest that is left on an account earns more interest. What's this called?
FinancialLiteracyTest2.question_4: What does it mean to be a shareholder?
FinancialLiteracyTest2.question_5: When is Johanna making an investment?
FinancialLiteracyTest2.question_6: Konrad earns $c{2000} and deposits $c{500} in a different account to not spend them. What is he doing?
FinancialLiteracyTest2.question_7: You ride your bike wearing a helmet. Kim rides without a helmet. What's true about the risk?
FinancialLiteracyTest2.question_8: Stella gets $c{50} each week and spends $c{40}. How many weeks does it take for her to afford a book for $c{100}?
FinancialLiteracyTest2.question_9: Danilo is paying a company to cover his costs in the event of an accident. What's this called?
FinancialLiteracyTest2.question_10: Moa is saving her money in a box, not in a savings account. What is she doing?
FinancialLiteracyTest2.question_4_answer_1: You lend money to a company
FinancialLiteracyTest2.question_4_answer_2: You borrow money from a bank
FinancialLiteracyTest2.question_4_answer_3: You own a part of a company
FinancialLiteracyTest2.question_4_answer_4: You manage salaries at a company
FinancialLiteracyTest2.question_5_answer_1: When she buys a new dishwasher
FinancialLiteracyTest2.question_5_answer_2: When she opens a bank account
FinancialLiteracyTest2.question_5_answer_3: When she gets a new credit card
FinancialLiteracyTest2.question_5_answer_4: When she buy stocks in a company
FinancialLiteracyTest2.question_7_answer_1: Both you and Kim reduce your risk of head injuries
FinancialLiteracyTest2.question_7_answer_2: Both you and Kim accept the risk of head injuries
FinancialLiteracyTest2.question_7_answer_3: You reduce your risk and Kim accepts his risk of head injuries
FinancialLiteracyTest2.question_7_answer_4: You accept your risk and Kim reduces his risk of head injuries

FinancialLiteracyTest3.question_1: Maria is shopping for school start. What's the smartest way for her to spend her money?
FinancialLiteracyTest3.question_2: What's an inevitable part of everyday life?
FinancialLiteracyTest3.question_3: What do most people usually do in order to afford to buy a house?
FinancialLiteracyTest3.question_4: Bella is making a budget. What's the most important thing to keep track of?
FinancialLiteracyTest3.question_5: Linnéa buys a basketball. Why do you think she buys it?
FinancialLiteracyTest3.question_6: What's the biggest advantage of borrowing money?
FinancialLiteracyTest3.question_7: Sara and Maria have the exact same cars, but Sara's insurance costs more. Why?
FinancialLiteracyTest3.question_8: Julia has $c{300} on her card and wants to buy headphones for $c{500}. Can she buy them?
FinancialLiteracyTest3.question_1_answer_1: To buy things she doesn't want on sale
FinancialLiteracyTest3.question_1_answer_2: To buy whatever her friends are buying
FinancialLiteracyTest3.question_1_answer_4: To list things she wants and check the price in advance
FinancialLiteracyTest3.question_3_answer_3: Get a loan from a bank
FinancialLiteracyTest3.question_6_answer_1: You can buy now and pay later
FinancialLiteracyTest3.question_6_answer_4: You can buy now and avoid paying
FinancialLiteracyTest3.question_7_answer_1: Sara doesn't have a savings account
FinancialLiteracyTest3.question_7_answer_2: Sara is not going to college
FinancialLiteracyTest3.question_7_answer_4: Sara got fired from a job
FinancialLiteracyTest3.question_8_answer_1: Yes, it takes two months for the money to be withdrawn
FinancialLiteracyTest3.question_8_answer_2: Yes, the store doesn't know how much money she has
FinancialLiteracyTest3.question_8_answer_4: No, she needs at least $c{1000} on the card
